body: Interesting use-case. How would that affect performance?

> @papppeter DI work with objects, but this is static, you must use something like this:
> 
> ```
> use system\widgets\Pjax;
> Pjax::begin();
> ...
> Pjax::end();
> ```

Pjax::begin() works out of the box. It is goes trough DI. Only the end() part does not. So from my point of view it is handled incosistently.

It is really helpfull if i would like to rewrite some vendor CRUDs which utilize widgets.

my use case is: 
- our projects relays on our vendor packages
- vendor need to be backward or/and all projects compatible (unfortunatelly we are not using versioning here - small team)
- we have modules in vendor which implements CRUDs
- we have one heavelly used theme widget Ibox (from inspinia theme) which was replaced with Box (from adminelte)
- with DI i could achive not to touch vendors and switch from Ibox to Box easily

I think widget DI would be a perfect addition to the framework.

@samdark I did not tested, but my solution is using basic php functions, i think it should not affect the performance. But if you are pozitive i could test it out.

@papppeter
> Pjax::begin() works out of the box.

I'm mean you can't call `Yii::$container->get(\yii\widgets\Pjax::class)->begin();`.
Can you post your view with Pjax?

> @papppeter
> 
> > Pjax::begin() works out of the box.
> 
> I'm mean you can't call `Yii::$container->get(\yii\widgets\Pjax::class)->begin();`. Can you post your view with Pjax?

my code looks following:
```
<?php
use yii\widgets\Pjax;
?>
<?php $pjaxWidget = Pjax::begin(); ?>
...
<?php Pjax::end(); ?>
```
Error:

Expecting end() of modules\system\widgets\Pjax, found yii\widgets\Pjax

So begin part calls  Yii::createObject -> modules\system\widgets\Pjax is used
End part does not take care of DI -> yii\widgets\Pjax is used
@papppeter i'm think it's wrong way, because you call `yii\widgets\Pjax::end();`, not `system\widgets\Pjax::end();` or `[get_class($pjaxWidget), 'end']()`
@papppeter you solution may create troubles at work in team: you hiddenly change functionality, IDE can't normally analyze code - your teammates must remember all your changes in project.

> @papppeter you solution may create troubles at work in team: you hiddenly change functionality, IDE can't normally analyze code - your teammates must remember all your changes in project.

@WinterSilence I do not agree with your statement. We have proper definitions.php in place, readmes etc. which tells my team how our system works. We are utilizing DI in our projects, which works perfectly everywhere but not with widgets.

IDE can normally analyze the code we still have only begin(), end() nothing changes.

So maybe you could explain a little bit more, with an example where do you see it will affect badly the code quality.
